item.title: The Tallyho Hotel: A Brief, Bold, and Forgotten Dream on the Las Vegas Strip
item.description:
A Luxurious Gamble That Didn’t Pay Off: The Tallyho Hotel and Country Club

The Las Vegas Strip is known for extravagance, innovation, and, above all, gambling. But in December 1962, a bold experiment challenged that very formula. Enter the Tallyho Hotel and Country Club, a luxury retreat unlike anything seen before (or since) on the Strip.

Edwin Lowe’s Vision: A Non-Gaming Oasis

The mastermind behind this unusual venture was Edwin S. Lowe, a name familiar to many for his role in popularizing Bingo and launching the iconic game Yahtzee. Lowe envisioned a sophisticated, non-gaming escape, a European-style country club experience transplanted to the Nevada desert. Situated directly across from the legendary Dunes Hotel, the Tallyhoâ€™s English Tudor architecture stood in stark contrast to the burgeoning modern aesthetic that was beginning to define the Strip.
